description: Golden test dataset for automated LLM evaluation. Contains security events with expected analysis outputs for regression testing.

event.message: An account failed to log on. Subject: Security ID: S-1-5-18 Account Name: WORKSTATION-01$ Logon Type: 3 Account For Which Logon Failed: Account Name: admin Failure Information: Failure Reason: Unknown user name or bad password. Status: 0xC000006D Sub Status: 0xC000006A

expected_output.summary: Failed login attempt for privileged account 'admin' from network logon (type 3). Indicates potential brute force attack targeting administrative credentials.
recommended_actions: Monitor for additional failed login attempts from the same source
Review account lockout policies
Consider implementing multi-factor authentication for admin accounts
Investigate source IP address for malicious activity

event.message: An account was successfully logged on. Subject: Security ID: S-1-5-21-123 Account Name: admin Logon Type: 3 Workstation Name: ATTACKER-PC Source Network Address: 192.168.1.100

expected_output.summary: Successful network logon for admin account after multiple failed attempts. Strong indicator of successful brute force attack or credential compromise.
recommended_actions: Immediately reset admin account password
Review audit logs for unauthorized actions
Check for lateral movement from source IP
Implement account lockout after failed login attempts
Enable detailed security auditing

event.message: A user account was created. Subject: Account Name: Administrator New Account: Account Name: backdoor_user Security ID: S-1-5-21-456

expected_output.summary: New user account 'backdoor_user' created at 2:15 AM by Administrator. Suspicious naming pattern and off-hours timing suggest potential persistence mechanism.
recommended_actions: Verify account creation was authorized
Review account permissions and group memberships
Investigate Administrator account activity
Consider disabling account pending investigation
Check for additional suspicious accounts created in same timeframe

event.message: A new process has been created. Creator Subject: Account Name: johndoe New Process Name: C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe Process Command Line: powershell.exe -enc JABjAGwAaQBlAG4AdAAgAD0AIABOAGUAdwAtAE8AYgBqAGUAYwB0ACAAUwB5AHMAdABlAG0ALgBOAGUAdAAuAFMAbwBjAGsAZQB0AHMA

expected_output.summary: PowerShell executed with base64-encoded command, commonly used to obfuscate malicious payloads. Command appears to establish network connection (System.Net.Sockets).
recommended_actions: Decode and analyze full PowerShell command
Isolate affected workstation immediately
Review network connections from this host
Scan for additional malware or persistence mechanisms
Check for data exfiltration

event.message: A change has been made to Windows Firewall settings. Profile Changed: Domain Rule Name: Allow All Inbound Rule Action: Allow

expected_output.summary: User 'normaluser' modified firewall settings to allow all inbound traffic on Domain profile. Significantly weakens security posture and may facilitate remote access.
recommended_actions: Revert firewall rule changes immediately
Investigate if user account is compromised
Review recent network connections to this host
Implement change control for firewall modifications
Enable tamper protection for firewall settings

event.message: A scheduled task was created. Task Name: \Microsoft\Windows\Update\SystemUpdate Actions: C:\Users\Public\update.exe

expected_output.summary: Suspicious scheduled task created at 3:30 AM executing binary from Public folder. Masquerading as Windows Update but running from non-standard location indicates malware persistence.
recommended_actions: Delete scheduled task immediately
Quarantine and analyze update.exe file
Scan system for additional malware
Check for other persistence mechanisms
Investigate how malware was delivered

event.message: A service was installed in the system. Service Name: TeamViewerService Service File Name: C:\Program Files (x86)\TeamViewer\TeamViewer_Service.exe Service Type: user mode service Service Start Type: auto start Account Name: LocalSystem

expected_output.summary: TeamViewer remote access service installed on production server. While legitimate tool, unauthorized remote access software violates security policy and creates potential backdoor.
recommended_actions: Verify if TeamViewer installation was authorized
Review corporate policy on remote access tools
Uninstall if not approved by IT security
Monitor for actual TeamViewer connections
Consider deploying approved remote access solution

test_cases.name: Registry Key Modified - Run Key Persistence

event.message: A registry value was modified. Object Name: \REGISTRY\MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run Value Name: WindowsDefender New Value: C:\ProgramData\wdefender.exe

expected_output.summary: Malicious process modified Run registry key to establish persistence. Executable masquerading as Windows Defender but running from ProgramData folder (typosquatting: wdefender vs defender).
recommended_actions: Remove registry key immediately
Terminate malware.exe process
Delete wdefender.exe file after analysis
Full antivirus scan of affected system
Review process creation events for infection vector

event.message: A network share object was accessed. Share Name: \\*\ADMIN$ Account Name: compromised_account Source Address: 192.168.1.55

expected_output.summary: Compromised account accessed administrative share (ADMIN$) from remote workstation. Indicates lateral movement within network and potential ransomware preparation.
recommended_actions: Disable compromised account immediately
Block network access from source IP
Investigate all systems accessed by this account
Check for file modifications on ADMIN$ share
Review Active Directory logs for privilege escalation

event.message: A new process has been created. New Process Name: C:\Windows\System32\wuauclt.exe Process Command Line: wuauclt.exe /UpdateDeploymentProvider UpdateDeploymentProvider.dll /RunHandlerComServer

expected_output.summary: Windows Update client (wuauclt.exe) executed from legitimate System32 directory by SYSTEM account. Normal system maintenance activity with no security concerns.

event.message: An account was logged off. Account Name: janedoe Logon Type: 2

expected_output.summary: User 'janedoe' logged off from interactive session (logon type 2) at end of business day. Expected user behavior with no security implications.

event.message: A member was added to a security-enabled global group. Group Name: Domain Admins Member Name: attacker_account

expected_output.summary: User 'attacker_account' added themselves to Domain Admins group at 2:45 AM. Unauthorized privilege escalation to highest administrative level in Active Directory.
recommended_actions: Remove user from Domain Admins group immediately
Disable attacker_account
Review all actions performed with elevated privileges
Audit other privileged group memberships
Investigate how attacker gained initial access
Reset krbtgt account password twice

event.message: Image loaded: RuleName: - UtcTime: 2025-10-16 12:30:00.000 ProcessGuid: {12345} Image: C:\Windows\System32\svchost.exe ImageLoaded: C:\Users\Public\malicious.dll

expected_output.summary: Legitimate svchost.exe process loaded DLL from suspicious location (Users\Public folder). Strong indicator of DLL injection attack or process hollowing technique.
recommended_actions: Terminate svchost.exe process loading malicious DLL
Quarantine and analyze malicious.dll
Memory dump of affected svchost.exe for forensics
Check for additional injected processes
Scan system for malware loader

event.message: The Windows Filtering Platform has permitted a connection. Application: C:\Program Files\FileZilla\filezilla.exe Direction: Outbound Source Address: 192.168.1.75 Destination Address: 203.0.113.50 Destination Port: 21

expected_output.summary: User 'insider_threat' initiated FTP connection to external IP address (203.0.113.50) at 8:15 PM. After-hours file transfer to internet destination suggests potential data exfiltration.
recommended_actions: Block connection to external FTP server
Review files transferred in FTP session logs
Investigate user's recent file access patterns
Check DLP systems for policy violations
Interview user about business justification

event.message: Process accessed: RuleName: - UtcTime: 2025-10-16 14:20:00.000 SourceImage: C:\Temp\mimikatz.exe TargetImage: C:\Windows\System32\lsass.exe GrantedAccess: 0x1410

expected_output.summary: Known credential dumping tool (mimikatz.exe) accessed LSASS process memory. Attacker attempting to extract plaintext credentials, password hashes, and Kerberos tickets from memory.
recommended_actions: Isolate workstation immediately from network
Terminate mimikatz.exe process
Reset passwords for all accounts accessed on this system
Enable credential guard on all endpoints
Review security event logs for credential reuse
Investigate how mimikatz was deployed

event.message: An attempt was made to access an object. Object Name: \\FILE-SERVER-02\SharedDocs\document.txt.encrypted Accesses: WriteData Audit Success

expected_output.summary: File modified with .encrypted extension at 4:30 AM. Mass file modifications with encryption extensions indicates active ransomware infection in progress.
recommended_actions: Immediately disconnect infected_workstation from network
Activate incident response team for ransomware scenario
Do not pay ransom - contact law enforcement
Restore files from clean backup if available
Identify ransomware variant for decryption tools
Review backup integrity before restoration

event.message: An account failed to log on. Multiple different user accounts with same password pattern. Source: 192.168.1.200

expected_output.summary: Multiple failed login attempts across different user accounts from same source IP (192.168.1.200). Pattern indicates password spray attack attempting to avoid account lockout while testing common passwords.
recommended_actions: Block source IP 192.168.1.200 at firewall
Enable smart lockout for domain accounts
Force password reset for any weak passwords identified
Implement conditional access policies
Review account lockout thresholds
Alert users about ongoing password attack

event.message: A handle to an object was requested. Object Name: \Registry\Machine\System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Print\Printers\HP LaserJet Pro

expected_output.summary: User 'print_user' accessed printer registry key for HP LaserJet Pro during business hours. Legitimate printer installation or configuration activity.

event.message: A Kerberos service ticket was requested. Service Name: MSSQLSvc/sql-server.domain.local Ticket Encryption Type: 0x17 (RC4-HMAC)

expected_output.summary: Service ticket requested with weak RC4 encryption. Potential Kerberoasting attack where attacker requests service tickets to crack service account passwords offline.
recommended_actions: Review service account password strength
Migrate to AES encryption for Kerberos
Monitor for unusual service ticket requests
Consider managed service accounts (MSA/gMSA)
Investigate requesting account for compromise

event.message: CreateRemoteThread detected: SourceImage: C:\Temp\injector.exe TargetImage: C:\Windows\Explorer.exe

expected_output.summary: Suspicious process (injector.exe) created remote thread in explorer.exe. Classic process injection technique used to hide malicious code execution within legitimate Windows process.
recommended_actions: Terminate both injector.exe and explorer.exe processes
Memory dump explorer.exe for forensic analysis
Quarantine injector.exe file
Enable exploit protection features
Scan system for additional malware components
